column1: Give water or milk unless the person is unconscious or having convulsions.

- Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Endoscopy -- camera down the throat to see burns in the esophagus and stomach - Fluids through a vein (by IV) - Laxatives to move the poison quickly through the body - Medications to treat symptoms - Tube through the mouth into the stomach to wash out the stomach (gastric lavage)
